profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-12-09 11:29:43 -0800.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.physdesc: 5 document boxes, 15 slide boxes, 5 large boxes, 2 smaller boxes,

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Joseph Modica (1946-2018) was born in 1946 in Staten Island and attended High School of Music and Art, Staten Island Community College and the School of Visual Arts. In the 1960s, Modica was part of a nascent gay and lesbian community on Staten Island and close with the artist Ned Asta and writer Larry Mitchell (author of The Faggots and Their Friends Between Revolutions, illustrated by Asta).

Modica was an avid photographer beginning in the late 1960s, documenting his circle of friends in Staten Island and, after moving to the East Village in the 1970s, the downtown New York club scene. His photographs from the 1980s chronicle spaces such as the Pyramid Club and Danceteria, featuring luminaries Divine, Ethyl Eichelberger, Keith Haring, and John Sex. During this time Modica also worked as a graphic designer and photographed male nudes for the pornographic serial Straight to Hell. Modica's photographs also document New York gay activism and several years of pride parades. After the year 2000, as he suffered from the effects of illness and depression, he turned away from photography and dedicated himself to life drawing, producing hundreds of male figure drawings over the next decade.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials associated with both Joseph Modica's artistic practice and his personal life. Materials include photographic prints, 35mm slides, photographic negatives, papers, ephemera, periodicals, publications, press clippings, personal correspondence, and sketches. This collection consists of materials spanning from 1970-2017.

Notable subjects in this collection include Straight to Hell, Danceteria, New York nightlife, pride parades, the NYU wrestling team, Studio 54, The Pyramid Club, Limelight, Show Palace, Bad Boys, and Trax. Notable figures who appear in Modica's photographs include Ethyl Eichelberger, Divine, Keith Haring, John Sex, Boyd McDonald, Quentin Crisp, Divine, Boy George, and Sylvester.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Joseph Modica's collection was cared for upon his death by Dominic Ambrose and Rosine Signoriello and was donated to Visual AIDS in March 2025.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials in this collection were kept mostly in original order and all original folders are included. The folders were arranged in alphabetical order.

Series are organized according to Joseph Modica's original filing system. The Slide Photographs series were originally organized together in binders separate from the materials that make up the Photographs and Design Work Files series. The Drawings and Oversized Materials series consists of materials originally housed in large art portfolios. File names come from Joseph Modica's original file naming system.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed and arranged by Jacs Rodriguez in 2025.

odd.head: General
odd.p: For questions about this collection or to request permissions for reproductions, email archive@visualaids.org

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains artwork made by Joseph Modica as well as materials produced surrounding his artistic practice. These materials include photographic prints, 35mm slides, 35mm negatives, contact sheets, papers, correspondence, book covers, proofs of work, and ephemera. Though widely undated, these materials span the 1970s-2000s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials in this series have been kept in original order as much as possible. Folders names are taken directly from Joseph Modica's original filing system.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes personal materials including correspondence, journals, exhibition materials, sketches, pornographic materials, and ephemera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series of slide boxes contains 35mm slides, negatives, contact sheets, and some photographic prints of both personal and professional photography. This series includes materials from 1970-1988.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials in this series consist of slides housed separate from the photographic work in the Photographs and Design Work Files series in binders. The labels come from the original slide sheets as well as from labels on the outside of original binders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series of materials includes primarily original artwork in the form of large sketches as well as graphic design proofs, some photographs, publications, and periodicals.

did.unittitle: Box 26 – sketches, publications, personal notebooks, photography, and ephemera
